Collection.name: Records
Collection.type: Eamon.ThirdParty.BTree`1[[Eamon.Framework.IEffect, Eamon, Version=1.6.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null]], Eamon, Version=1.6.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: distance, you see majestic mountains rise, their peaks glistening white spires that jut upward from the low valley.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The faded words on the signpost read:*003

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Aedrahr's Landing - North 40 leagues**004

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Wyveryn Mountains - South 60 leagues**005

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Glengarry Falls - Northeast 17 leagues**006

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Geldhaven - East 9 leagues

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Rings of Zylo

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: It says, "Johan's Backpack". But not really clear on who Johan is or how you came to acquire his backpack!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: loaves of bread

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: It says, "AYERS FINE CHOCOLATES".

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The tome appears to be some sort of journal.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The pages are filled with handwritten text detailing the adventures of someone named Johan. The dated entries span several months.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: After a cursory viewing, most of the entries appear to be tall tales, or at least exaggerated for effect. Regardless, its not clear at all why the tome was abandoned.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The leaflet has a series of runes inscribed on it.*016

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: Little else can be gleaned based on your current level of knowledge.*017

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: It is in a strange pictographic language that you don't understand.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: At this point, you abandon your efforts to decipher the leaflet, intending to take it to Hokas for review at your earliest convenience.

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: As you approach the chest, it suddenly comes alive and numerous tentacles burst out of it. The chest starts to move awkwardly, propelled by small, stout tentacles underneath!*019

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The creature's tentacles flail wildly as it searches for a victim to maul.*020

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: The chest monster advances toward you menacingly, somehow sensing your presence. **021

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: At this point you fall into its grasp!!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: It says, "Abandon all hope, ye who enter here!!!"

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: This is a sample adventure intoduction story. Normally, you'll want to put something clever or exciting here, to intrigue the player or further describe the scenario.@@PB**024

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: But in the case of Test Adventure, please be aware this is a test adventure in the literal sense: badly written, lacking any narrative and a jumble of far-too-many artifacts packed into far-too-few rooms. It was **025

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: built in an ad-hoc manner to stress test various parts of Eamon CS during development. As such, it is not really suitable for regular characters to adventure in.@@PB**026

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: It is included in the distribution because it exercises the game engine in a more rounded way than The Beginner's Cave. Please feel free to look around!

Simple.name: Desc
Simple.value: unnatural and poses questions in your mind.
